title: [To dev/1.3] Fix ThreadPoolMetrics concurrent NPE bug
body: cp https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/14388

title: Fix ThreadPoolMetrics concurrent NPE bug & Fix metric leaks when frequently creating and deleting database
body:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e8029adc-be8a-4903-b0c4-0f8999a53211)

Fix four metric leaks when frequently creating and deleting database
* ThreadPoolMetrics
* Points internalReporter
* file_global_count
* mem in dataregionMetrics

title: Fix wal queue stuck and fix wal_queue_max_mem_size metric
body:
## Description

The nonFullCondition in MemoryControlledWALEntryQueue should be static. Otherwise, the MemoryControlledWALEntryQueue may stuck.

This PR also fixed the wal_queue_max_mem_size metric no data problem.

title: Add `removeInput` and `removable` to some specific Accmulators
body:
## Description
Add `removeInput` and `removable` to some Accumulators in Table Model for Window Function use.

These following Accumulators have been influenced:
- AvgAccumulator
- SumAccumulator
- CountAccumulator
- TableModeAccumulator
- TableVarianceAccumulator

title: [Table Model Subquery] Support uncorrelated in predicate subquery
Fix error in MergeSortJoin when some columns exist null values & Support cross join with filters.
body:
## Description

Support most inner joins, full outer joins and cross joins such as:

```
select * from t1 join t2 on t1.device=t2.device;
select * from t1 join t2 on t1.time=t2.time;
select * from t1 join t2 on t1.time=t2.time AND t1.device=t2.device;
select * from t1 join t2 USING(device);
select * from t1 join t2 USING(time);
select * from t1 join t2 USING(device, time);
select * from t1 join t2 on t1.time>t2.time AND t1.device=t2.device;
select * from t1 join t2 on t1.time>t2.time OR t1.device=t2.device;
select * from t1 join t2 WHERE t1.device=t2.device;
select * from t1 join t2 WHERE t1.time=t2.time;
select * from t1 join t2 WHERE t1.time=t2.time AND t1.device=t2.device;
select * from t1 join t2 WHERE t1.time>t2.time OR t1.device=t2.device;
select s1 from t1 where s1 = select max(s1) from t1; ---> will use nestedloopjoin
select * from t1 join t2 WHERE t1.value*10=t2.value; ---> will use MergeSortNode
select t1.time from tablea t1 join tableb t2 on t1.value*10=t2.value and substring(t1.device,2)=substring(t2.device,2); -- will use MergeSortNode
```

title: add todos check
Add method getDataNodeCpuCoreCount back
Supprt trusted_uri_pattern in config file
body:
Previously, if one user has USE_UDF privilege, he can create any function from any uri address which may load some unsafe jar file into IoTDB process.

So we add a trusted_uri_pattern parameter in config file which is a Java-style regex, only uri match that pattern can be used to create udf, trigger or pipePlugin. And that parameter defaultly is `file:.*` which only allows for files in local file system

title: Modify UDF time precision
body:
## Modify UDF time precision

### The following functions in the UDF will be modified: 
### 1) **Completeness**, **Consistency**, **Timeliness**, and **Validity** functions in data quality; 
### 2) the **IFFT** function in frequency domain analysis; 
### 3) the **Resample** function in data profiling; 
### 4) the **ConsecutiveSequences** and **ConsecutiveWindows** functions in sequence discovery. 
### These modifications will enable the functions to support seven time units: 'ns' (nanoseconds), 'us' (microseconds), 'ms' (milliseconds), 's' (seconds), 'm' (minutes), 'h' (hours), and 'd' (days). Additionally, the input time precision for these functions will default to match the system's time precision.

title: test ci
WAL buffer queue memory control
body:
## Description

This PR introduces memory control for the WAL buffer queue to ensure efficient resource utilization and prevent memory overuse.
* Default Memory Limit: The maximum memory size for the WAL entry queue is set to 1/10 of the memtable memory by default.
* Blocking Behavior: If the total memory size of the WAL entry queue exceeds this limit, calls to the put method of the WAL entry queue will be blocked until sufficient memory is freed.

This enhancement improves stability by aligning WAL entry queue memory usage with the systems memory management strategy.

body: as title currently, iotv2 will only fail in unstable ITs where iotv1 will fail as well. for tests that will run per commit, iotv2 passed all

title: Region Migration: Fix migration failed when there are unknown nodes
body: Considering cluster may have unknown nodes when migrate regions, all action related to migration should not panic exceptons. Instead, we just need to log a warn log

title: Add AccessControl support for query and database related
Add format function
body:
This pull request introduces a new `FORMAT` function to the IoTDB query engine, along with the necessary infrastructure to support it. The primary changes include the addition of the `FormatColumnTransformer` class, updates to the `TableBuiltinScalarFunction` enum, and modifications to various files to incorporate the new function.

### Major Changes:

**New Functionality:**
* Added the `FormatColumnTransformer` class to handle the `FORMAT` function in query transformations. (`iotdb-core/datanode/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/db/queryengine/transformation/dag/column/unary/scalar/FormatColumnTransformer.java`)

**Integration with Query Engine:**
* Updated the `TableBuiltinScalarFunction` enum to include the new `FORMAT` function. (`iotdb-core/datanode/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/db/queryengine/transformation/dag/column/unary/scalar/TableBuiltinScalarFunction.java`)
* Modified the `ColumnTransformerBuilder` to create a `FormatColumnTransformer` when the `FORMAT` function is used. (`iotdb-core/datanode/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/db/queryengine/execution/relational/ColumnTransformerBuilder.java`) [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-3b0b89be6f0edd72821d73b79d483f69cff0bcd87b29b4d645fc733c0f9ad4e8R119) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-3b0b89be6f0edd72821d73b79d483f69cff0bcd87b29b4d645fc733c0f9ad4e8R1000-R1009)
* Added validation in `TableMetadataImpl` to ensure the first argument of the `FORMAT` function is a char type. (`iotdb-core/datanode/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/db/queryengine/plan/relational/metadata/TableMetadataImpl.java`)

**Utility Enhancements:**
* Added methods in `DateTimeUtils` to convert timestamps to `LocalDateTime` and `ZonedDateTime`, which are used by the `FormatColumnTransformer`. (`iotdb-core/datanode/src/main/java/org/apache/iotdb/db/utils/DateTimeUtils.java`)

**Testing:**
* Created a new integration test class `IoTDBFormatFunctionTableIT` to test the `FORMAT` function with various data types. (`integration-test/src/test/java/org/apache/iotdb/relational/it/query/old/builtinfunction/scalar/IoTDBFormatFunctionTableIT.java`)##
